ETYMOLOGY: From Old French destination (14c.), from Latin destinatio 'a determining, purpose,' noun of action from destinare 'to determine, establish, make firm,' from de- 'fully, thoroughly' + stare 'to stand'. The meaning 'a place to which one is going' emerged in the 18th century.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The place to which someone or something is going or being sent.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 目的地；终点；旅途的终点
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Our flight's final destination is London Heathrow Airport.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们航班的最终目的地是伦敦希思罗机场。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The predetermined end or purpose of a journey or process; fate or destiny.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Some philosophers argue that all human actions lead to a predetermined destination.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 一些哲学家认为，人类所有的行为都通向一个注定的归宿。
